mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to John Alton, Mount Vernon, 1759 April 1
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Expects to be up [to Mount Vernon] tomorrow -- Miles sent to get key from Col. Fairfax -- Alton to get house in order, make fires in lower rooms and air them -- two bedsteads put up, one in hall room, one in little dining room -- get out chairs and tables and clean and rub them and stair case -- find eggs and chickens and "prepare in the best manner you can for our coming." Autograph letter signed, integral cover, docketed, "Given to Mr. [ ] Clemson - January 24th 1832 at Mount Vernon by Mrs. Jane Washington supposed to have been written soon after his marriage and Braddocks defeat." Autograph letter signed, 1 page, laminated, watermark (crown over encircled shield & motto Honi soit qui mal y pense). Name on original manuscript appears as "G. Washington". Date on original catalog card appears [1759] [April 1].
